title: ITV releases first trailer for Belgravia, from the makers of Downton
text:
From Good Housekeeping

Julian Fellowes is the creator of one of ITV’s most successful shows ever – Downton Abbey – so it’s unsurprising the channel is working with him on another period drama.

ITV has commissioned a six-part series called Belgravia from Fellowes and revealed some exciting cast news.

Tamsin Greig, Philip Glenister, Harriet Walter and Alice Eve will all star in the drama, it's been announced.

Photo credit: Getty Images More

ITV has also revealed a first look trailer. Watch it here:

Belgravia: What's it about?

The plot centres on the upmarket Belgravia area of London in the 1840s, with the story beginning 25 years earlier on the eve of Napoleon’s battle against the Duke of Wellington at Waterloo.

On 15 June 1815, British society has gathered at a ball in Brussels ahead of the battle – one person in attendance is Sophia Trenchard, the young and beautiful daughter of Wellington’s chief supplier. That night changes everything for Sophia but it’s only decades later, when she’s living in Belgravia that the true repercussions will be felt.

Fellowes published Belgravia as a novel in 2016 and will adapt it for TV himself.

ITV's head of drama Polly Hill said: "We're delighted to be reuniting with Julian Fellowes, Gareth Neame and Carnival Films to produce Belgravia for ITV. It's a tale of scandal and intrigue set in 1840s London with some wonderful characters spanning two generations at its heart."

Photo credit: ITV More

Belgravia: Who's in it?

The show's stellar ensemble cast including Tamsin Greig (Episodes), Philip Glenister (Mad Dogs), Harriet Walter (The Crown) and Alice Eve (She’s Out Of My League), Tara Fitzgerald (Game of Thrones), Ella Purnell (Miss Peregrine’s Home For Peculiar Children), Richard Goulding (The Windsors), James Fleet (Four Weddings and a Funeral), Adam James (Band of Brothers), Paul Ritter (Friday Night Dinner) and Saskia Reeves (Luther).

Belgravia: When's it on TV?

The series will air on ITV at some point in 2020. Watch this space for a more exact date.

Belgravia will air on ITV.
